conclusion: When the light source moves forward, above the objects, the shadows cast by the objects will change in size and position.
There are four objects labeled A, B, C, and D above slabs, each casting shadows on the ground.
The shadow of Object A will become larger and more pronounced because the light source is moving closer to Object A, causing the shadow to stretch out further and become more elongated.
The shadow of Object B will also become larger and more pronounced because the light source is moving closer to Object B, causing the shadow to stretch out further and become more elongated.
The shadow of Object C will become smaller and more pronounced because the light source is moving closer to Object C, causing the shadow to stretch out further and become more elongated.

The shadow of Object D will remain relatively unchanged because the light source is moving closer to Object D, but the light is still being cast from a greater distance, causing the shadow to stretch out further but not change in size.
In summary, the shadows cast by Object A, Object B, and Object C will become larger and more pronounced, while the shadow of Object D will remain relatively unchanged.
